title: Sam Kieth miniseries (Zero Girl-OJO-Four Women...)
description:
Legs (One-Shot)
Released in 1999 by Image Comics.
"Sam 'Foot Fetish' Kieth's story about a boy and his alien pet. And he will be cleaning up after it."



Zero Girl
Five-issue mini-series published by Homage Comics (an imprint of DC) in 2001.
"The plot concerns high school student Amy Smootster, and her attempts to start a relationship with her guidance counselor Tim. Another plot thread follows her relationship with circles and squares---it seems that circular objects tend to help or defend her, while squares try to hurt her. All of this has something to do with her feet producing copious but never-defined fluid when she feels shame."


Zero Girl - Full Circle
It was published in 2003 by Homage Comics as well.
"This was a five-issue follow-up story (to Zero Girl), set fifteen years later, called Zero Girl: Full Circle, which put Amy and Tim in the background and focused on Tim's daughter, Nikki."



Four Women
It was released from late 2001 to early 2002 by Homage Comics.
"Four Women is an American five-part limited series. Written and drawn by Sam Kieth, it deals with four female friends of varying ages -- Donna, Bev, Marion and Cindy -- and a road trip during which they are attacked and sexually assaulted by two men. The story mostly takes place in a flashback as Donna recounts the story to her psychiatrist."



Wolverine Hulk
Four issue mini-series published by Marvel Comics in 2002
In this series, Hulk and Wolverine get in charge of a mysterious girl who suddenly pops up in their lives. Of course, this means trouble is soon to follow.



OJO
Five-issue mini-series published by ONI Press in the late 2004 and early 2005.
In this mini, Kieth has help from Alex Pardee and Chris Wisnia with the illustrations.
"Annie has terrible luck with pets. She's killed hamsters and mice and lizards and birds. For a domesticated animal, getting Annie as an owner is akin to a death sentence. But when Annie finds a little beastie named Ojo in a drain pipe, has her karma really changed or is she destined for more disappointment?"



Scratch
Five-issue mini-series published by DC in 2004.
"Scratch is a five issue mini-series, written and drawn by Kieth. The story centers on a werewolf named Scratch who lives in a small town which finds a number of children have gone missing. Naturally, because he's the local freak, Scratch is fingered as the main suspect, but the story's not quite that simple, naturally. Oh, and a certain Dark Knight is set to make an appearance."



My Inner Bimbo
Five-issue mini-series published by ONI Press in 2007/2008.
Issues 2-5 are co-illustrated by Josh Hagler.
"There are two sides to every coin, every story, and every person. No matter how hard you try to hide that second face away, you can never get rid of it. That's what one man is about to learn when his under-developed feminine side materializes into a very real bubble gum-chewing bimbo and turns his world upside down!"



Batman Lobo - Deadly Serious
Two-issue mini-series published by DC in 2007. While it's two issues, they are in prestige format, so each comic is 48 pages.
That would be the equivalent of a regular four-issue mini.
"Sam Kieth, Batman, Lobo, Spaceships, Alien disease that makes women turn into homicidal maniacs, explosions, lots of guns, aliens.
